intro: Gyrostemon blancoi, commonly known as the Mexican starflower, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. The plant features showy, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Gyrostemon blancoi is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
